All products featured on Architectural Digest are independently selected by our editors. However, we may receive compensation from retailers and/or from purchases of products through these links.

Featured in this article

The best upholstered beds are ideal for people who prefer soft textures rather than wood surfaces to tie a room together. From a Scandinavian-meets-farmhouse abode to a Dallas dwelling with antique touches, refined spaces around the world feature this frame type. We also appreciate the versatility that comes with an upholstered bed; you can go big (think bold colorways and curved head and footboards) or you can leverage subtle texture and materials for something more quiet.

Unlike wood beds that sometimes need a polish or re-stain to stay in peak condition, fabric-covered frames typically come in breathable cotton, linen, or engineered performance fabrics to make them easier to clean. To streamline your shopping process, our guide features options our editors have tried and tested, from low profile to platform and minimalist to maximalist styles. We also scoured our favorite furniture stores for even more shopper-approved picks. Below, the best upholstered bed frames we love.

For consistency, all prices reflect queen size frames. However, many brands have options that range from twin to California king.

  • Best Overall

    1/5

    Article Cigar Storage Bed

    Our top pick in our best storage beds guide, this linen upholstered frame is a classic with soft, organic edges. Lisa Aiken, SVP of commerce, felt instantly drawn to its understated aesthetic and its practical, discreet storage drawers. After using it for months, it hasn’t disappointed style- or functionality-wise. Aiken has this piece in her guest room, which boasts high ceilings, natural light, and a relaxed mid-century modern vibe. “The design and upholstery of this bed frame perfectly complements the overall minimalist bedroom design, providing a subtle yet elevated focal point in the room,” she says. You don’t have to be a minimalist to appreciate this piece, we think it’d be well suited for eclectic and coastal design styles as well.

    Specs:

    • Upholstery material: Linen blend fabric
    • Sizes available: Queen, King
    • Finishes available: Ankara ivory, birch ivory

  • A Soft Bouclé Bed

    2/5

    Sundays Cloud Bed with Storage

    This bouclé bed frame scored high marks from senior commerce editor Nashia Baker for the “soft yet durable” fabric. As someone who previously owned solid wood or metal frames, this one brings the cozy feel she always envisioned for her space. “My bedroom design is a mix between modern and Mediterranean,” she says. “I love elements that blend both warm, light colors with clean lines, so this storage bed felt like a no brainer for me.” Although she has it in a cream colorway, she hasn’t noticed any signs of the fabric getting dingy or stained over time. Bonus: This frame has a hydraulic, lift-up under-bed storage system that allows her to tuck all of her excess bedding away without overcrowding her NYC apartment.

    Specs:

    • Upholstery material: Bouclé fabric
    • Sizes available: Full, Queen, King
    • Finishes available: 3

  • The Affordable Pick

    3/5

    Allewie Lift Up Storage Bed with Wingback Headboard

    Coming in at less than $300, contributor Will Porter is a fan of this Amazon best seller for its approachable price point as well as its versatile build. “Currently, the bedroom is set up quite minimally, with just the storage bed, a rug, and an end table on each side of the mattress,” he says. “I opted for the beige modern version of the bed (there are 14 options total: seven colorways and two design options), which looks great with my light blue rug. It looks great as a standalone piece but could also accommodate a bench or low couch at the foot of the bed.” Aside from the integrated headboard, features like lift-up storage make it a great choice for a small space.

    Specs:

    • Upholstery material: Performance fabric
    • Sizes available: Full, Queen, King
    • Finishes available: 7

  • A Statement Storage Option

    4/5

    Castlery Dalton Storage Bed

    If you’re on the hunt for a high-quality bed that can serve as the centerpiece in a room, Aiken also recommends this new style from Castlery. “The statement made by the large wingback cushioned headboard really made this bed frame stand out, giving a less usual silhouette and making a visual impact in the space of the master bedroom,” she says. “I am always on the lookout for extra storage, and the three large built-in drawers are exactly what I needed.” The fabric is a highlight, as well, as it has the relaxed look of linen, even though it is primarily made of polyester.

    Specs:

    • Upholstery material: Non-woven polyester fabric
    • Sizes available: Twin, Full, Queen, California King
    • Finishes available: 1

  • For the Best of Both Worlds

    5/5

    Thuma Classic Pillowboard Bed

    If you’re not fully ready to transition from a wood bed to an upholstered one, the fabric headboard and exposed wooden base here will give indecisive shoppers the best of both worlds. Senior digital design editor Zoë Sessums was “very pleased with the easy assembly and the heft of the frame” as well as the simple Japanese-inspired joinery that gives it a durable feel. The performance material is made with a blend of polyester, viscose, and linen blend to help prevent staining or wear and tear over the years.

    Specs:

    • Upholstery material: Performance linen blend
    • Sizes available: Twin, Full, Queen, California King
    • Finishes available: 8

More Upholstered Beds We’re Browsing

Arhaus Mariel Bed

If your bedroom leans traditional, this heritage upholstery bed and sculptural headboard will breathe life into your interiors. Its silhouette is inspired by Old World aesthetics with subtle touches like soft curves, turned-style legs, and a scalloped headboard. Finishing touches like channel stitching give it a thoughtful feel that can complement any space inspired by times past.

Specs:

  • Upholstery material: Performance fabric
  • Sizes available: Queen, King
  • Finishes available: 2

Mermelada Estudio Forte Bed

With a buttery appearance from the smooth fabric as well as bold, clean lines, this channel-tufted bed is truly designed to make a statement. We can instantly picture this in a maximalist space from the unique colorways like olive and midnight blue and chenille-like material.

Specs:

  • Upholstery material: Grey Crypton performance fabric
  • Sizes available: Queen, King
  • Finishes available: 3

Ellison Studios Lull Bed

Looking for a frame that offers an effortlessly elegant appeal? Then your journey stops here. Inspired by a contemporary ‘70s bedroom, Design Within Reach’s frame has a multitude of bold colors to choose from in a velvet fabric for a sumptuous sleep setup.

Specs:

  • Upholstery material: 100% recycled polyester
  • Sizes available: Twin, Full, Queen, King
  • Finishes available: 7

Lulu and Georgia Westmont Platform Bed

Shoppers with an affinity for cottagecore design have met their match. Dressed in a blue gingham print with ruffled details, this platform bed frame evokes the same charm you’d find in a quaint cabin in the woods. It’s also made with durability in mind thanks to the 100% cotton fabric and pine hardwood foundation, frills and all.

Specs:

  • Upholstery material: 100% cotton
  • Sizes available: Twin, Full, Queen, King, California King
  • Finishes available: 29

How We Tested

All of the top picks in this story are upholstered beds our editors and contributors have (and love) in their homes, from soft boucle to a relaxed linen fabric. As design editors, we’re always scanning our favorite furniture retailers for the latest styles that hit the market to fit anyone’s interior design aesthetic.

FAQs

Which fabrics are most durable for upscale beds?

Some of the most durable fabrics you can find are cotton, polyester, and linen. First and foremost, these are all breathable materials that can help resist moisture buildup, especially if you live in a hotter, humid climate. That aside, these are known as performance fabrics because they are easier to clean, typically with a gentle soap and water mixture.

Are tufted or smooth panels more timeless?

Our answer: both! Each of these styles can be found anywhere in nearly any type of bedroom design. However, since tufted offers more visual appeal, it can be a more versatile option for a maximalist space, like the Forte frame above, while smooth panels lean more minimalist.
